result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael L Phillips was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's copy of Civil Judgment for Unpaid Court Obligations returned.  No forwarding address.
Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Status conference on August 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Atty Sattler requested Court reschedule trial date as she was preparing for 3 felony cases for trial the same date; Atty White had no objection; Court will reschedule dates for JS/JT
Final pre-trial on July 10, 2015 at 10:45 am.

Court adjourned final pretrial hearing as Defendant did not appear; Atty Welch contacted the Court later in the day and advised the Defendant had contacted him stating he had miscalendared his court date; Atty Sattler had no objection to the Court not issuing a BW for the Defendant's non appearance; Court will reschedule FPT and set dates for STC/JS/JT

ADDRESS INFO for Michael L Phillips
Current: PO Box 14191, Madison, WI 53708 United States  (Effective: 05-19-2015)
Prior: 1941 Post Rd Apt 113, Fitchburg, WI 53713
Bond check to def/poster returned as undeliverable as addressed.  Unable to forward.  Check already voided and reissued to new address provided.
Final pre-trial on June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
  - Defendant shall abide by the Injunction issued in Case No. 14CV3121.
  - Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Christina D.
  Trial Judge - Br 5

Defendant appeared.  Jason D. Sanders appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
